content.description: Amazing and obvious line or "seam" in the shallow dihedral of the North face of lower boulder.  Two distinct crux areas with sustained climbing.  Unfortunately the second crux is 10 ft from the top of this extreme high ball boulder problem.
content.protection:
Lots of pads, spotters, your priest, whatever you can get on your side before you do it! This would be a bold ass boulder problem as the hard moves are the final ones. Usually considered a toprope, but anchors would have to come from the ground on the opposite side of the boulder(weird). Down climb either Hard Point (West side) or Captain Coconut (East side).  You can also toss or bring a rope with you. 

  A very attractive, and dangerous, boulder problem.
content.location: North face of lower of the two boulders that form split rocks. Down climb either Hard Point (West side) or Captain Coconut (East side).  You can also toss or bring a rope with you.

content.description: Route is on the East corner of the upper boulder.  Really good climb.  Crux is in the middle, 7-10 ft of the ground.  It gets a lot easier towards the top.
content.protection: Lots of pads and spotters. High ball problem 25 ft tall.
content.location: Upper boulder of split rocks.  Eastern most arete.

content.description: Starts just to the right of the seam of death.  Crouch start with left foot on the face and hands on two crimps.  Pull yourself onto the face, make several delicate yet powerful face moves to eventually gain the notch of the foothold of Eye of the Chicken.  From there it joins EOTC and goes to the arete to the top.
content.protection: Lots of pads, spotters and overcoming the mind game.
content.location: North face of the lower boulder of Split Rocks.  Moves to the West Arete and to the top.

content.description: West side of lower boulder.  Starts on a couple jugs.  You have your choice of three starting hand holds and left foot on a notch on the face and right foot on a chip of the underbelly.  Move up with a hard move onto the face and then right to the arete and follow it to the top.
content.protection: Lots of pads and spotters.  Landing is on a slope so be careful.
content.location: West side on the North face of the lower boulder

content.description:
This is the exact opposite of "Black Pearl". Make a couple improbable face moves until you can grab the arête with your left hand. You'll feel much better after this, until you get higher. As soon as you start to get scared, the arête grants you with solid left handed grips and feet. Cool problem. 

  Descent, down climb "Real Boat" like all other problems here.
content.protection: Use pads, they hadn't been invented when this got done.

content.description: Uses the same start as seam of death and quickly moves to the left face and heads up and over to the crack system on the left(East) side of the North face of the lower boulder.  It then moves up and to the top.  Same route can be used as a down climb or you can use Hard Point as a down climb.
content.protection: Lots of pads, spotters and anything else you can think of!
content.location: Downhill boulder of Split Rocks.  Route is located on the East side of the North face.

content.description: West side of the uphill boulder. Left side of the arete.  Start facing Southeast towards the arete and proceeds to the top.  Downclmb Real Boat.
content.location: Uphill boulder of Split Rocks.  West corner, left side of arete

content.description: Less than 5 minutes from the parking lot on the way up to the Kingdom of Zilch.  Amazing two boulders that at one time were one but split apart to form two pieces.  Always some routes are in the shade and some are in the sun!
